description: Integer part of arithmetic mean of distinct numbers that can be formed from the nonzero digits of n.
references: Amarnath Murthy, An Interesting result in Combinatorics, Mathematics and Informatics Quarterly, 3/99, vol. 9, Bulgaria.
example: a(10) = floor(1+10)/2 =5. a(12) = 9: the distinct numbers formed by the digits of 12 are 1, 2, 12, 21. The arithmetic mean of these numbers is 36/4 = 9.
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, May 06 2001
extensions: Corrected and extended by Asher Natan Auel (auela(AT)reed.edu), May 14, 2001
